15521.content: Morgan the cutest Tactician and much better than his female counterpart, great choice!
15521.title: Morgan (male)

155211.content:
(This takes place immediately after Morgan is recruited, he also doesn't have amnesia)

Morgan was going through his weapons preparing for battle. "Let's see, here is my iron sword, my Elfire tome and-" Morgan was interrupted as he heard someone enter his tent. Morgan turned around and saw his mother, Robin. "Hi mom, do you need anything?" Morgan asked politely turning his attention away from his gear. "Yes Morgan, I need to test this spell." Robin said to the young tactician.

"Okay, do I need anything to help prepare it?" Morgan asked to his white haired mother. "All you have to do is stay still" Robin said, Morgan nodded before staying completely still. Robin sent out a small blue energy ball that touched Morgan. The boy ended up shrinking to an inch tall. Robin smiled "Seems like it was a success" Morgan matched her smile "So now that we know that it works can you change me back?" Morgan requested, at this Robin frowned and shook her head. "No, I'm not going to change you back." Morgan's eyes widened "B-but why, I need to prepare for the upcoming battle." Morgan argued, Robin sighed sadly "Morgan, you're ten years old, you already had to deal with so much in the future I don't want you to get hurt. You shouldn't have to fight a war." Robin explained to her child. "But where am I going to stay?" Morgan asked to his towering mother. "Well that's simple during each battle I will have someone who isn't participating look after you." Robin explained to her small son. "So are you not going to be in today's battle?" Morgan asked to the Grandmaster who frowned again. "Unfortunately no, your father as specifically requested me to fight by his side today. But don't worry the person who is going to look after you will do a fantastic job."

Who is Morgan going to stay with first?
155211.title: Protection

choices: Morgan and Tiki chat for a while.
Morgan and Tiki are attacked! Tiki has to protect Morgan!
Morgan want to play a game with Tiki!
1552113.content:
Right after Robin tells Morgan this, another woman who Morgan did not recognize as of yet walked in. It was a woman with green hair tied into a neat ponytail. She had a red outfit on with a pink bow tied around her waist.

"Hello Robin." She said, her voice sounding rather...divine.

"Hello Tiki, I promise I'll make this up to you. Thank you for keeping Morgan safe for me." Robin said. The woman giggled.

"There's no need to 'make it up to me'. I'm glad I can help." She said with a soft smile. Robin was gathering her stuff to leave.

"Alright, I'm needed elsewhere...I'll leave this up to you Tiki. Just promise me one thing, do NOT join this battle. I need someone to keep Morgan safe..."

"Of course. I promise I'll keep him safe Robin." She said.

Robin nods to her and runs out. "Stay safe Morgan!" She yells as she leaves.

Tiki slowly walks over to the table and sits down. She bent over the table slightly to talk to Morgan, and he noticed her absolute titanic breasts. They were huge! They were bigger than any woman he'd seen in the Shepherds, and that was against some stiff competition. And Tiki just so happened to be wearing an outfit that revealed a generous amount of cleavage. Morgan blushed as he attempted to avert his eyes. He didn't want her to catch him staring.

"Greetings Morgan. My name is Tiki. I will be your guardian until Robin returns." She said sweetly. She had an...odd aura about her. One of grace and elegance. He could tell she would be gentle with him.

"Hello Tiki. Nice to meet you!" He exclaimed. Tiki giggled.

"My you're an energetic one aren't you?" She said softly. Morgan was warming up to her already.

The battle began outside, and Morgan could hear sounds of swords, spells, and the occasional grunt. An explosion from a Bolganone spell caused him to fall over. It didn't shake the room much, but at his size, it felt like an earthquake. Tiki chuckled as she helped him up, and pat his head.

Morgan looked at the door in worry. He didn't like it when his mother had to go into battle...

"Do not worry, Robin will be alright. She's done this many a time before." Tiki said. Holy shit did she read his mind or something?

Morgan sighed in worry, before looking up at Tiki.

"Sorry..." He said, looking up at her.

"No need to apologize. I understand." Tiki said with a soft smile.

"Would you like to do something to pass the time? And take your mind off of the battle?" Tiki asked.

"Hmm...sure!" Morgan said, getting excited again.

-------------

What ends up "passing the time" for Morgan and Tiki?
1552113.title: Draconic Guardian

155212.content:
"This does not make me a pervert." Morgan quietly said to himself standing outside of a tent. Now you might be asking what the heck is going on here. Let me explain.

Several weeks ago Morgan's bed and blankets were destroyed in an accident that involved cats, an arcfire tome and a dragonstone and did not involve Morgan himself. Morgan was given a replacement bed, blankets and pillows. However they were absolutely terrible, Morgan had suffered through many sleepless nights due to not having a cozy place to sleep and from being extremely cold. Morgan believed that asking for proper bedding would be a waste of money for the shepherds so he turned to magic.

Morgan found a spell that would shrink him to an inch in height and would make him invincible and unable to feel pain. Morgan than devised a plan to snuggle up with different female shepherds as a way to have a proper place to sleep without them knowing. He also found a teleportation spell to use in the event the shepherd was about to wake up (Unknown to Morgan this spell had a 50% success rate).

Now Morgan was standing in front of a tent for his first night using his shrink spell but who is he going to sleep with and with what part?
155212.title: Sleep Deprived Tactician

"Interesting, I didn't know spirits could have a humanesque form, at least not at that size" Korra jumps when she hears the even tones of Tenzin's eldest child, Jinora, the girl who makes her look like an idiot on top of a shitty airbender, though at least unlike most people the girl wasn't smug about it, she really did behave like her people should, a real peacemaker or at least a pacifist, even if at times it comes off as not giving a shit.

"Jinora, don't do that" Korra hisses, taking a moment to realise she was currently smothering Morgan against her chest "Shit, sorry bud, you okay?"

Morgan nods "I'm fine. Hello, I'm Morgan"

"I'm Jinora. Hey Korra, does dad know you have a boy in the house? Does Asami?" she curl of her lip makes Korra question the girl's parentage just for a moment, then again she is Lin's favourite of Tenzin's kids, makes sense that one would be the snarkiest of the 3.

"No Jinora, nobody knows, as I only just found him. He's lost and confused and could really use a friend, know what I mean?" she feels bad trying to manipulate the younger girl, but she knows it's the easiest way to deal with the situation, plus she knows Jinorra doesn't have any friends besides Korra and her friends, and her siblings were a pain in the ass so the bookworm was on her own, A LOT. Maybe making a new friend will help make things better for her

Jinorra frowns, before sitting down "Do you want to be my friend little guy?" she asks Morgan directly, surprising the boy

"Yes, you seem nice and Korra seems to vouch for you, why wouldn't I want to be your friend?" Morgan chuckles, then yelps as another mini twister takes him from Korra's hands, this time into Jinora's

"You are very cute, I think we'll be good friends Morgan" she smiles sweetly, petting his head

What now?

1) Morgan is happy to make friends, and wants to give them something to mark the occasion, even if that means magical cookies! (Technically Jinora is Morgan's age, but fell free to make her a little older)

2) The socially awkward air bender feels something strange with Morgan, something she never felt before. She wants to hold him close and never let go, she wants to be his and for him to be hers. Morgan left one world and found another girl to develop a crush on him

3) Korra takes him back, wanting to introduce him to all her friends, but promises to bring him back so they can play later. Jinora nods reluctantly

1552143.content:
"Morgan...wake uuup!" A voice was heard, in slight sing-song. Whoever it was was in a good mood. Before we go any further, let me explain this...odd situation. In this room lay a little boy. No, really, a LITTLE boy. He was only about an inch or two tall, and slept in a bed faaaaaaar tinier than any of us ever thought possible. This child's name was Morgan. He was only about seven or eight years old, and was a cheerful and bright boy. The voice calling to him was his mother, Severa. She was a woman of average height and build. She had scarlet red hair and slightly larger than average sized breasts. She also had MAJOR self-esteem issues, and she was prone to going on angry rants and being short of patience with people. Deep down however, she was a caring loving soul, that just needed to open herself up to you to consider you a true friend. But to Morgan, she was his loving mother.

"Morgan. Wake up." The voice said, slightly sterner this time. Severa was rocking Morgan's bed to wake him up, but he was still fast asleep. Severa's face had an expression of annoyance on it, Morgan's sleepiness getting on her nerves. Her patience already hit it's end, and the day hadn't even started.

"MORGAN!" She said, slamming the table next to the bed. The resulting mini-earthquake on the table caused Morgan to snap awake in terror.

"Waaah!" He exclaimed, falling out of his bed. His covers fell onto him, and he couldn't see.anything. Severa smirked as she saw her son fall, but quickly regretted her actions. She helped Morgan up as she giggled.

"Sorry about that Morgan. You weren't waking up." She said bluntly, but with a smile of affection on her face.

"It's okay Mother. Just...wasn't expecting that." He said, getting up and dusting off his pajamas. "Err...wait. Why did you wake me up? You usually don't wake me up this early." He said, curious. Severa's face glistened.

"I wanted to spend the day with you Morgan. It's not like we get to spend much time anymore. You better be grateful!" She said, her defensive wall of an attitude showing to even her son. Morgan knew not to take her seriously.

"I am, I am. Just let me get dressed and we can spend the day together!" Morgan said happily. Severa smiled sweetly, something rare for her, as she simply nodded and sat down in a chair meant for her or Robin. Oh right! Robin! He was the gifted tactician for the Shepherds, and has an intellect unlike any other. He and Severa had often gotten into "arguments", which is mostly Severa screaming at Robin because she felt inadequate next to his admittedly superior intellect. Severa wasn't stupid in any way. In fact she was quite intelligent, much like her mother Cordelia; However her hot-tempered nature and lack of patience caused her to get frustrated rather quickly, clouding her mind.

Morgan got out of his pajamas and into his casual clothes. He had a mini tactician's outfit much like his fathers, but he felt like he didn't really need it. He brushed his teeth with a small brush and a puddle of water, and presented himself to his mother.

"Ready mom! Let's go!" He exclaimed, jumping into the air.

"Ugh...finally! Took ya long enough." She said sarcastically, before smiling, revealing a bit of playfulness. She walked over to the table and knelt down. She pat Morgan on the head and giggled.

"What do you wanna do?" Morgan asked, excited.

--------------

What does Severa have planned for their day together?

15521433.content:
A smile formed on Severa's face as she picked him up gently, letting him stand on her palm.

"I'll just keep that a secret for now." She said with a sly smile on her face. Morgan didn't know what she meant by that. Soon after, a rather soft and weak knock was heard at the door. Whoever was knocking clearly didn't want to make themselves known, or they were rather meek. Or both.

"H-Hello? Is anyone in here?" The voice said weakly. Severa turned to look at the door.

"Yeah, come on in Noire, it's open." Severa said. After that, the door slowly opened to reveal a rather meek, shy girl on the other side. She was rather average height, black hair, and she was wearing a green archer outfit he's seen several times before. What made her body really stand out was her chest. Her chest was enormous. To Morgan, they were the biggest ones he'd ever seen, and that was against some stiff competition. She walked forward slowly, her body stance one of weakness and fear as she entered the room to meet Severa.

"Hi Severa." She said.

"Hey Noire, you ready to hang out with Morgan and I today?" She asked with a smile on her face. It seemed she was genuinely excited for today, even if she wasn't showing it.

"Y-Yes...! Um...hi Morgan." She said, shifting her gaze to the boy. He looked up and smiled sweetly.

"Hi Noire! Nice to see you!" He said. Severa shifted her body to get both of their attention as she cleared her throat.

"Noire's joining us on our day out Morgan! It'll be the three of us, it'll be fun." She said with a smile before looking away.

"not that it wouldn't have been fun with just me..." She said under her breath.

"Ready! Let's do this!" Morgan exclaimed happily, Noire smiled softly, Morgan's enthusiasm calming her down.

----------

What do Severa, Morgan and Noire do together?
15521433.title: Noire joins in!

choices: The group finishes their meal and decide to walk around the town.
Severa and Noire decide to order a couple of drinks, and start to get tipsy!

155214331.content:
Severa brought Morgan up to her shoulder and placed him gently on it. He sat down on his mother's shoulder as Severa turned to Noire.

"Hey, before we spend the day out on the town, do you wanna grab a bite to eat? I'm starving." Severa asked, Noire smiled.

"Sure! I-I wouldn't mind getting something to eat with you two." Noire said. Severa chuckled.

"Alright come on, I know a place in town that makes the most delicious sweets you'll ever taste." Severa said, beginning to walk towards the door. Morgan had already been used to riding on someone's shoulder due to his size, so he wasn't thrown off or disoriented in the slightest when Severa began to move. Severa made a motion for Noire to follow.

"Alright! R-Right behind you." Noire said, walking out of the door. Severa locked the door behind them and walked out into the town. After the war, the town blossomed into a bustling city full of people running left and right getting things done. It was quite hectic, but also quite peaceful at the same time. Severa walked with Morgan on her shoulder, Noire following closely behind. They engaged in some small talk on the way over, but nothing quite interesting enough to keep Morgan's attention. Eventually, they reached the sweet shop.

"Here it is. Best sweets in town. I mean, it's not the only thing they serve here but whatever." She said bluntly.

"Ooh! I can't wait to see what they have..!" Noire said. After getting a table and receiving a menu, they sat there and watched the hustle and bustle of the town. Eventually, they had ordered and gotten their food.

Morgan had gotten a large chocolate chip cookie and a glass of water that was comparable to an ocean for him. Severa got a cinnamon frosted roll and a small sandwich, and Noire had gotten a rather large pastry that Morgan wondered if she'd be able to finish.

"Mmm..!" Noire said with a full mouth before swallowing. "These are delicious! How come I'd never heard of this place before?" Noire asked. Severa chuckled.

"It's new. This place only opened up about a month ago. Mother was telling me the details of how she came here with Father, so I decided to check it out with both of you." Severa said.

"Although i could've come up with a place myself..." Severa said under her breath. Noire noticed.

"What was that?" Noire asked.

"Nothing!" Severa snarkily responded, her walls immediately flying up. She turned down to Morgan to change the subject. He was laying on top of the half finished cookie with a tired expression on his face. To a normal person, he had just eaten a bite, but to him, he'd just stuffed his belly with sweet cookie goodness. "How was the cookie Morgan?" She asked.

"It was delicious Mother! Promise me we'll come back here again with Father!" He said excitedly, Severa chuckled and pet his hair.

"We'll be back, I promise." Severa said with a smirk on her face.

"Yaaay!" Morgan exclaimed. Noire let out a light belch, and immediately covered her mouth with a blush.

"S-Sorry! Sorry!" Noire exclaimed. Both Morgan and Severa laughed.

They continued to eat their sweets, chat and people watch, just making the most out of their day before they went on to do other things later together. Severa looked at the menu again, just scanning for something else they might want before they left.

After the battle with Grima ended, the children of the future went on to pursue their own interests. While some stayed close with their parents, others either felt it best to not interfere with their soon-to-be born selves, or simply had their own interests that they wanted to pursue. One of these latter children was Morgan, son of Robin and prince of Ylisse. He still loved his parents and his sister, but he was an adult and wanted his own destiny, something new to see, so he set off to explore.

During his travels, he came across a strange gate on a southern island, said to lead to other worlds. Morgan's near child-like curiosity kicked in and lead to him entering the gate. On the other side, he found a world almost identical to the one he left behind. The only differences were that this world's Robin was male rather than female like his mother, rather than giving birth to a son named Morgan, this world's Morgan was Robin's daughter, and lastly, while Grima had been defeated here, the Shepards and their children remained together on the march in a military camp to personally clean up any Grimleal stragglers.

When Morgan had learned all of this, he tried to go back through the gate so as not to interfere with such a similar world, only to find himself unable to go back through the gate home. Whatever power that allowed him to come here was now gone. Seeing little other choice, the young man approached this world's Robin and explained to him the rather... complicated situation of all this. The tactician, while skeptical at first, soon welcomed his alternate reality son with open arms and even adopted him before introducing him to his new mother Lissa, and his adoptive "siblings", Owain and... Morgan.

To say it was awkward when these two first met would be an understatement. How one even begins to explain introducing your gender-bent self from another world was something that escaped Robin. Her pegasus was waiting not too far from Corrin's house, and making sure Kana was safe, jumped onto her pegasus.

"I thought you might like an air ride. You know, soaring through the air and taking in the sights." She said, buckling the food and water pouches to the pegasus instead of keeping them on her.

"Really? I've never been on a pegasus before! What's it like?" Kana innocently said. Hinoka chuckled.

"Heh. Well, you're about to find out!" She excitedly said. To keep Kana safe, Hinoka placed him inside of her shirt, but let the collar pin him to her body near her neck so he can see outwards. Kana wouldn't move from there, and that way she could maneuver her mount while still keeping him safe. "You ready Kana?" She said, unable to see him.

"Ready Auntie Hinoka! Let's do this!" He responded.

"Alright, let's go! Yah!" Hinoka said, commanding the pegasus to fly. After a rather intense vertical rise for Kana, him needing to clutch onto her scarf, Hinoka soon stabilized their air height and they were both cruising several hundred feet in the air. Hinoka'd been up much higher before, but for his first time, she thought she shouldn't go THAT far up.

"Woooooooow!" This is so coooooool!" Kana said, his jaw dropped from how beautiful the world looked from a few hundred feet up. He attempted to wriggle free from Hinoka's collar and jumped out to land on the pegasus before landing on Hinoka's hand.

"No no Kana! You can't come out of there! You might fall down! If a blast of wind blows through you'll get swept right off!" She said protectively, a bit of her softer side showing through. "I don't want you to fall..." She said. Bringing him closer to her face. She ruffled his hair again before putting him back in her collar. He didn't really mind, but he was kinda disappointed that he couldn't sightsee on his own up in the air, although she seemed to have a point.

"Hey." Hinoka said, grabbing Kana's attention. She didn't want the day to be ruined by a simple refusal from her. "If you're done sightseeing, we can go back down and do something else. And you know what? We can even do whatever you want!" Hinoka said.

"Really?!" Kana asked excitedly, his mind already rushing with things to do with Auntie Hinoka. "Alright! Let's go!" He said. Hinoka chuckled.

"Well you're eager aren't you?" She said with a smirk on her face. "Alright, we're going down! Yah!" She commanded, as the pegasus began travelling downwards at a brisk rate. The angle of the descent was less than ideal, and Kana latched onto Hinoka's scarf, hoping to not be thrown about or lose his grip. The speed that Hinoka was descending could also prove a bit of a problem...

1553131412.content:
Kana's grip was slipping fast! Hinoka was headed down too steeply! His grip finally failed him and he was sent into a free-fall hundreds of feet in the air. Hinoka's descent outpaced Kana's free-fall, and after a brief moment, Hinoka noticed Kana wasn't in her collar anymore.

"Kana? Where are you?!" Hinoka said worriedly, opening the front of her shirt to see if he slipped into her shirt. Suddenly, she heard something that sent a chill down her spine.

"Aaaaaaaahhhhhhh!" Kana screamed, the ground was getting close REEEEEAAALLLY quickly, and he didn't want to think about what would happen if he hit it.

"K-Kana!" Hinoka yelled, she stopped her descent in it's tracks and begins to fly back upwards to catch him.

"Auntie Hinokaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!" Kana screamed. "Heeeeeeeeeeeellllllp!"

"I'm coming Kana!" Hinoka yelled.

The distance between the two got shorter and shorter, Kana praying to...anything for Hinoka to actually catch him.

What happens to Kana?
1553131412.title: Free Fallin'

choices: Camilla shows Kana to her, safe and unharmed.
Camilla tries to lie to keep Kana to herself. Hinoka isn't buying it.
Camilla tries to calm Hinoka down before anything else.
15531314123.content:
As the distance between Hinoka and Kana got smaller and smaller, their hearts rose further and further into their throats. If Hinoka missed, Kana would fall to the ground. If he fell to the ground...

Suddenly, as Kana was falling closer and closer into Hinoka's grasp, an "unknown" flier came speeding out of nowhere and grabbed Kana out of midair!

"W-What?!" Hinoka exclaimed, stopping her Pegasus dead in it's tracks. She looked over the side of her mount and saw a quite familiar wyvern flying away at top speed. The flier herself did not look back at Hinoka, but she didn't need to, Hinoka already clearly knew who it was.

"Camilla..." Hinoka said with slight frustration. She was happy, and immensely relieved that she saved Kana, but now he's being taken from her! The wyvern was getting smaller and smaller as it got further from her, and only the whinny from her Pegasus brought her back to reality. "Come back here!" She yelled, before giving chase.

She had let quite the distance build up unintentionally between them, and Camilla's wyvern was already landed and she was nowhere to be seen. Hinoka landed her Pegasus not too far away from where her wyvern was and ran through the halls of Corrin's castle. She accidentally took a wrong turn in her hurry and blind panic, but eventually she found herself at Camilla's living quarters. She kicked the door open.

"Camilla!" Hinoka yelled. Camilla acted shocked.

"M-My! Hinoka! What's got you all riled up?" She asked. Hinoka's tone may not have been the best, but she was still in complete panic and adrenaline from Kana's fall. It didn't seem like she was going to calm down for a while.

"Kana! Where is he? He was falling...and I...you..." Hinoka said, practically hyperventilating. Not only was she out of breath from her sprint to her room, her heart as previously said was in her throat.

"I just hope he's okay...I didn't want anything to happen to him..." Hinoka said. Camilla knew what was wrong with her. After Corrin's kidnapping from Hoshido all of those years ago, Hinoka's guilt and anger for being powerless to help never truly went away, and if anything happened to Kana, not only would Corrin want her head on a silver platter, (she knew how Corrin was with Kana.), Hinoka would never forgive herself.

"Well..." Camilla began.

15531314123.title: An Unexpected Save

1553132.content:
Kana was extremely happy. His mother Corrin had finally take him out of his deep realm and even gave him a dragon stone so he could control himself in his dragon form. Which he discovered he had yesterday.

Kana was outside, no one else was around, as far as he knew. He held up his dragon stone, closed his eyes and focused. Instead of feeling himself transform into a dragon he felt like he was getting smaller. When he opened eyes he had found out that he had shrunken to only a couple of inches tall. To make matters worse he started feeling the ground shake. Kana turned around and saw....
1553132.title: Faulty Dragon Stone

choices: Corrin wants to spend the day with the shrunken Kana!
Corrin heads back to her living quarters to keep Kana safe.
Kana wants to get back to normal size, and asks Corrin to find Azura.
15531321.content:
The ground's tremors got more intense with each passing second. He looked up and saw his precious mama looking down at him with a worried expression on her face. She scratched her head in confusion.

"Oops..that...wasn't supposed to happen." She said out loud. She knelled down to get a better look at Kana. "You okay Kana?" She asked worriedly. In reality, he was completely fine, but he was a little scared about being this small.

"I-I'm fine Mama. What happened to me?" He asked. Corrin rubbed the back of her head with a worried smile on her face.

"I don't know. The stone was SUPPOSED to turn you into a dragon like mine does. I'm not sure why it shrunk you down." She said.

"I'll have to ask Azura about this. Do you still have the stone?" She asked. Kana looked around on the ground and noticed the shrunken stone a few feet from him. It seems the stone shrunk along with him. He looked at it, and noticed that there was a very pronounced crack in the center. This only worried him further, but he looked up to answer.

"Yeah, I have it. There's a big crack in the stone. Is that supposed to be there?"

"A crack? No? Was the stone faulty?" She asked herself. "Never mind about that now, let me get you out of here. C'mon." She said, extending her hand to the floor. Kana mounted his mama's hand, and she brought him close to her face. The sudden shift of Corrin's hand made Kana slightly nauseous. Kana looked at his mother, and noticed she was smiling affectionately.

"Mama's got you. You're safe Kana." She said. Corrin opened a small compartment in her armor, and placed Kana inside. The "pocket" was just deep enough for Kana to stand up in, and still see outside. Corrin admitted to herself that Kana was especially cute at his size.

What happens next?

choices: Camilla wants to spend time together by walking around the castle!
Camilla wants to bring Kana back to her room!

15531322.content:
As Kana turned around, he looked up, only to see two gigantic orbs blocking his view. Kana instantly knew who this was.

"A-Auntie Camilla? Is that you?" Kana said, slightly worried. He heard a rather loud giggle as she bent over to reveal her face. When she bent over, Kana got a grand view of her rather huge breasts. He looked away instantly, not wanting to be rude.

"Yes it's me Kana~. I must say I didn't expect the dragonstone to shrink you down..." Camilla began, getting down on her knees to look at Kana.

"But I must say you look absolutely adorable at this size!" Camilla exclaimed. Before Kana could react, Camilla had already picked him up and brought him close to her face.

"Aaaaah...! I-Is there a way to bring me back to normal?" Kana asked.

"Hmm..." Camilla pondered. "There might be, but I'd have to ask Azura about it. But why would you want to go back to normal? You're so cute~!" Camila said, petting his head with one finger. Before Kana could respond, Camilla brought him close to her chest to give him a big hug, and Kana got his face smothered with Camilla's huge breasts.

"I can barely contain myself from just smothering you with love!" Camilla said affectionately.

"You're already doing that...!" Kana said, before Camilla brought him back onto her palm.

"Oops...! Sorry dearie~ I can get a little ahead of myself." Camilla said with a smile.

"In fact...why don't we spend a little time together Kana? It's been a while since I got to spend time with my wittle nephew~" Camilla asked.

"Um...sure! What did you have in mind?" Kana said. He was still worried about getting back to normal size, but he could spend some time with Auntie Camilla first.


"Hmmm...." Camilla pondered, bringing a finger to her chin.

choices: The "forbidden magic" is found the next day by Edelgard

155331112111.content:
Somewhere on the continent of Fódlan a young woman swung her axe at the last bandit that was in sight. The bandit who had apparently been wounded at some point during the battle attempted to dodge the axe attack but he wasn't fast enough. The bandit fell down dead at Edelgard's feet. The blood of the bandit made a graceful arc through the air as the axe buried itself in the midsection of the bandit. Edelgard was able to back off so that the blood of the bandit wouldn't end up on her.
"Another bandit falls to my blade" said Edelgard in a quiet voice. The Heir Apparent of the Adrestrian Empire spent a few moments looking down at the dead bandit until she noticed something poking out of a bag that the bandit was carrying. Edelgard reached to grab the bag and picked it up. The something turned out to be some sort of map. It was a map of the local area. One area of the map was circled with the words "forbidden magic?" written just below it .
"What do you have there, Edie?"
Edelgard looked up to see Dorothea walking towards her followed closely by Hubert. A dozen or so steps behind Hubert was Catherine who had joined the Black Eagles in getting rid of these bandits simply on a whim. Catherine didn't often join in bandit hunting and instead stayed at the monastery to guard the archbishop. The voice that had spoken belonged to Dorothea who had a nickname for everyone.
"I don't know" replied Edelgard. " Some kind of map this bandit was carrying "
"No doubt showing the location of the local bandit den" said Hubert glancing at the map in Edelgard's hand.
Dorothea looked at the map. "Forbidden magic? What's that supposed to mean?"
" I don't recall any magics that are forbidden " said Hubert thoughtfully rubbing his chin. Indeed, magics of all sorts were taught at the mines be it light magic or black.
"Where's Professor Byleth?" asked Catherine who had finally caught up.
" I'm not sure" said Dorothea. "He and I were separated like ten minutes ago"
Catherine noticed the map that Edelgard was holding and immediately snatched it and looked at it.
" You could've at least asked me to hand that over" said Edelgard.
"Hmm" said Catherine. "Forbidden magic? Does it mean that there's forbidden magic at the location...?"
" We can't be sure until we investigate the location the map indicates " said Hubert.
Catherine glanced at the sky. It was late evening.
"It can wait until tomorrow" said Catherine . "If we hurry we'll be back at the monastery before nightfall"
" But what about Professor Byleth? " asked Dorothea. "We just can't leave him out here"
As if on cue, Professor Byleth appeared from behind a tree.
"There you are" said Catherine giving the newest professor at the monastery a grin. "You ought to have been closer to your students than you were during the battle"
"Couldn't be helped" replied Byleth. "I was chasing down the chief of these bandits"
In short order the other members of the Black Eagles were found and so the group returned to the monastery.

1553311212111.content:
Footsteps clattering. The sounds of many war cries. Horses galloping and Pegasuses' flapping through the air.          Suddenly, in the midst of the battle, a hot bolt crashed down and burned away all in its path as fire erupted around it. Then, a large man claimed this bolt—a sword—by its hilt, and facing this man was a woman in white. As the woman's soldiers charged to meet this man, his sword lit up, and with it he swung it as a whip to unleash a maelstrom of fell power. The sight did not deter the woman, and she raised her sword high with hate burning bright in her eyes. And then, the two clashed in a frenzy of attacks.
         While the man appeared to have the upper hand, he got too confident and soon found his whip-like blade caught upon that of the woman's, and she readily yanked the blade from him before darting his way, landing fierce unarmed blows to knock him down. He struggled to get up, only to be pinned down by the woman with her dagger drawn.
         "Tell me, Nemesis," the woman snarled. "Do you recall the red canyon?" His eyes widened as realization dawned upon him, but it was not for long before the woman raised her dagger and brought it down upon him. "You'll die for that!" The woman was relentless, screaming as she filling the still man with holes. "You took…everything that I loved!" Eventually, he was no more, and as the rain stopped the sun finally shone through, basking the woman in the light of victory at last. Her men cheered for the larger man's demise but she had drowned it out. She reached for the sword wielded by the man she called "Nemesis", caressing its blood-stained blade against her face. "He's gone now, Mother…"
         The vision began to blur into darkness, and strange imagery of times and places far removed flashed by, only to be replaced with the dark once more. Then, there was a grand stairway leading up to a throne, and on that throne sat a sleeping young girl. She stirred in her sleep, slowly opening her eyes as she returned to the waking world, and that was when she laid eyes upon you.
         "Oh my," she said. "What could've brought you here?" You did not know that yourself, but it all felt familiar. "It is most rude to interrupt a moment of repose. Very rude indeed." You had not intended that, not even knowing where you were or why you were here, but you kept silent. "Now come to me. I wish to have a look at you." info.brief_description: Anything goes in this story! All ideas, weirdness, and fetishes supported!
info.description:
The Fire Emblem series is a series with a ton of awesome characters! This story is a place where ANYTHING AND EVERYTHING can happen to them!


Here are the rules:

1. Please keep the story in English, and use decent grammar.

2. For the sake of the story, please add a decent amount per chapter if you would like to post. If I notice a string of 1 or 2 sentence chapters, I will delete them for the sake of quality.

3. Please allow several story slots for characters. If starting a story or path, please include an "Another story" choice so that other kinds of stories can happen with the same characters.


Aaaaand....that's it! Everything else is fair game!

Warning: This story contains or will contain any and all kinds of content, please be advised.


And if you're reading this and like Fire Emblem and Breast Expansion, there's an entire interactive for just that!

Link: https://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/2180743-Fire-Emblem-Breast-Expansi...
